node.display_long_description:
UPDATE: Snowball weapon, spectator mode, new skin, new Ozo lounge, and more!

“One of the Best VR Experiences of 2020.” 5/5 Review - TheGamer

“Must Buy” - VRScout

Enter the Arena!
Duel players and bots to rise to the top League with your loadout assembled from collected weapons. The competitive game of endless skill depth you were looking for from the makers of Acron, Cook-Out & Angry Birds VR.

In this slow motion bullet-hell, you duck, dodge and weave to evade incoming attacks while preparing your dazzling next combos in a flash of skill. You feel like Neo and leave each session with your heart racing - super fun tactical workout.

● Duel players in real-time from around the world
● Level-up to collect weapons of increasing depth
● Balance your weapons’ spawn time & their role
● Learn new tricks, add them to your strategy & play style
● Track the meta tweaked every month
● Play friends in private duels (single account ok)
● Join a community of players for tips, practice & friends!

nodes.title: Mad March Update - replays, weapon skins, new avatar and more
nodes.body_text:
Hey Blasters,

We’ve got some cool stuff lined up for you this time! Introducing replays, a new weapon, a new punky avatar and more.

Highlighted updates
- Added replays of your latest game - watch your most recent game to spot any areas of improvement or have another look at your epic moves
- Multiple weapon skin sets added to the store - per popular demand, you can now choose between several cool styles for your weapons
- New weapon: Nova Helix - deny space on your opponent's platform with this helix weapon. Difficult to defend but the opponent can dodge through the center. Be ready with a follow-up shot!
- New character: Hax - fierce, punky and ready to fire it up

You can find the full list of changes and fixes in the news section in-game.

We can’t wait to see you try the updates!
/The Blaston Team

nodes.title: Fierce February Update - New game modes, upcoming tournaments and more
nodes.body_text:
Salutations, Blasters! We’re happy to be back with the first update of the year and we’ve got some good stuff packed into this one, including new game mode, an upcoming tournament mode, character skins and more!

Highlighted updates:
- Dual Modes - level up to unlock different modes, such as a queue without bots, practice while you wait and a training mode
- Tournament Mode - we’re excited to implement this mode and the first official tournament will take place soon. More info to come
- Skins - brand new character color swap skins have been added
- Spawn System - no more duplicate spawning. Weapons will not spawn again until the current version is destroyed. You can hold the opponent's weapon to prevent spawning
- Quest 2 90hz update

You can find the full list of changes and fixes in the news section in-game.

We hope you enjoy these updates and see you in the arena!
The Blaston Team

node.reviewDescription:
This game is really good, I mean really good. This is one of my favorite games on the quest as of right now, but I do have a few things that I would like to say to people who are going to buy this game.

1) DON’T BUY IF YOU DON’T WANT COMPETITION 

This game has no single player, so you will be only playing online. Sometimes you will get paired with a bot if the game can’t find another player, but this doesn’t happen all the time. The people on the game are really competitive, so if your not looking for a challenge I would not recommend. This is definitely not a game meant for the casual user. If I had to say something to devs, it would be to add a single player mode to the game, I personally have no complaints but I know many other people who can’t compete online would really appreciate a more laid back experience (Side note: when I say the community is competitive, I don’t mean toxic, many of the people I have meat are very nice and I almost always get a fist bump at the end of a round. If you don’t feel comfortable talking to people you can always turn off your mic)

2) THIS GAME IS VERY MOVEMENT ORIENTED

This game WILL make you break a sweat, especially if you want to play well. There is a lot of moving around and arm flailing, so if your not in vr for exercise don’t try to play this. Me and my friend played for about 10 minutes and were already exhausted, I don’t know if that is just because we are unfit, but I have played many other movement games and have never been as exhausted as after playing this one.

Now, I would like to go ahead and say that these are not complaints, I absolutely love the game, I just wanted to write this for people who don’t know what the game entails. I did not know these things getting into the game, but I still like it nonetheless. The only thing I would recommend to a dev is a single player mode for reasons I stated earlier. Overall, great game, it’s a steal for 10 bucks as long as you don’t mind challenge and exercise.

website_page_meta.description:
Do you have what it takes to rise the ranks and be this season’s champion in Resolution Games’ fiercely competitive VR dueling game?

Join the growing community and compete within the slow motion bullet-hell of Blaston, which The Gamer calls “One of the Best VR Experiences of 2020.” Prepare to continuously dodge, duck and weave to evade incoming attacks from your opponent in this FPS PvP combat game that combines skill, strategy & speed with an incredible arsenal of futuristic high-tech weapons.
website_page_meta.title: Blaston · Oculus Quest
